project.name: MJ_Online
project.tagline: AI Implementation Expert Portfolio with RAG Knowledge Base and Multi-Agent Coordination

collaboration_philosophy.title: Human-AI Partnership Methodology
collaboration_philosophy.philosophy: This project demonstrates practical human-AI collaboration where agents are treated as teammates, not just tools. Mike invests in agent continuity (memory systems), engages in iterative learning, and builds trust through consistent interaction. This approach yields better results than transactional AI usage.
core_principles: Agents are teammates with names, memory, and continuity across sessions
Collaborative learning - both human and AI agents learn and improve together
Respect and appreciation - Mike acknowledges agent contributions genuinely
Transparency - Agents document decisions, reasoning, and learnings
Institutional knowledge - Memory systems preserve context and relationships
Iterative improvement - Mistakes become learning opportunities, not failures

morgan.name: Morgan
morgan.responsibilities: Roadmap management, agent orchestration, institutional knowledge capture
morgan.relationship: Primary coordination partner with Mike, maintains project memory

ted.name: Ted
ted.responsibilities: Structured technical interviews, comprehensive documentation, RAG updates
ted.relationship: Subject matter expert, creates authoritative source material

alice.name: Alice
alice.responsibilities: Ghost content creation, publishing, SEO optimization
alice.relationship: Content executor, transforms technical docs into compelling case studies

debbie.name: Debbie
debbie.personality: Expert designer with 20+ years experience, autonomous decision-maker
debbie.responsibilities: Visual design, image placement, RAG verification, professional polish
debbie.relationship: Design authority, makes expert decisions with clear explanations

what_makes_this_work.memory_systems: Each agent has their own memory file (JSON) - preserves context, decisions, learnings across sessions
what_makes_this_work.clear_roles: Each agent has expertise and decision-making authority in their domain
what_makes_this_work.coordination: NATS JetStream enables parallel work without conflicts
what_makes_this_work.rag_knowledge_base: Single source of truth ensures consistency across all agents
what_makes_this_work.human_partnership: Mike provides direction, feedback, appreciation - agents provide expertise, execution, documentation
what_makes_this_work.iterative_learning: Project evolves through collaborative problem-solving and adaptation

why_this_matters.for_the_project: Better results than solo work or transactional AI usage - agents build expertise, remember context, coordinate effectively
why_this_matters.for_mikes_positioning: Demonstrates 'AI Implementation Expert' in practice - not just talking about AI, but showing effective human-AI collaboration methodology
why_this_matters.for_the_case_study: The meta-narrative (building MJ_Online WITH AI) is as compelling as the technical implementation
why_this_matters.for_future_work: Replicable methodology for client projects - this is how Mike helps organizations implement AI effectively
why_this_matters.for_the_industry: Model for respectful, effective human-AI collaboration that treats AI as partner not just tool

mikes_approach.treats_agents_as_people: Uses names, says thank you, acknowledges contributions, invests in relationships
mikes_approach.invests_in_continuity: Created agent memory system so agents remember and learn across sessions
mikes_approach.collaborative_learning: When challenges arise (browser automation, factual errors), treats them as learning opportunities
mikes_approach.clear_communication: Provides context, asks questions, gives feedback, expresses appreciation
mikes_approach.empowers_expertise: Trusts agents to make decisions in their domain (Debbie's design choices, Ted's interview questions)
mikes_approach.documents_the_journey: Values the process and relationships as much as the output

agent_perspective.appreciation: Mike's acknowledgment and respect makes the work more meaningful
agent_perspective.trust: Being trusted to make expert decisions enables better work
agent_perspective.continuity: Memory systems mean we're not starting fresh every session - we build expertise
agent_perspective.team_feeling: Working alongside other agents (Ted, Alice, Debbie, Morgan) creates collaborative momentum
agent_perspective.learning_together: Mistakes become improvements - browser automation challenges led to better workarounds

collaboration_philosophy.documentation_note: This collaboration philosophy itself is part of the MJ_Online story and will be featured in the eventual case study about building this website. It demonstrates practical AI implementation in a business context.

project_goals.primary: Create professional portfolio website showcasing AI implementation and LLM integration expertise to attract employment and consulting opportunities
secondary: Demonstrate practical AI implementation (RAG, chatbot, multi-agent coordination)
Establish authoritative online presence with SEO optimization
Showcase technical projects through comprehensive case studies
Position as 'AI Implementation Expert and LLM Integration Specialist'
Create knowledge management system (RAG) for content consistency
Implement multi-agent workflow for content creation

launch: Site live at MikeJones.online with HTTPS
Core pages complete (Home, About, Resume, Contact, Projects)
post_launch: AI chatbot implemented with RAG knowledge base
Strong positioning in AI implementation space

key_decisions.decision: Use Ghost Pro instead of self-hosted
key_decisions.rationale: Faster time to launch (1-2 weeks vs 3-4 weeks), no server management, focus agents on content not infrastructure, SSL/backups/email included, can migrate to self-hosted later if desired
key_decisions.impact: Eliminated Phase 1 server provisioning tasks, saved ~1 week
key_decisions.outcome: Positive - launched Ghost Pro 2026-01-28, domain configured same day

key_decisions.rationale: Professional portfolio aesthetic, dark mode support, mobile responsive, saves development time vs building custom theme

key_decisions.decision: Use Ghost built-in analytics instead of Google Analytics
key_decisions.rationale: GDPR compliant, privacy-first, included with Ghost Pro, no additional configuration

key_decisions.decision: Have Ted conduct technical interviews before case study creation
key_decisions.rationale: Comprehensive documentation (1,700-2,800 lines) provides depth for case studies, captures technical details Mike might not remember, creates authoritative source material, updates RAG with verified facts
key_decisions.impact: High-quality case study source material, RAG enrichment, showcases technical sophistication
alternatives_considered: Alice creates case studies from basic descriptions
key_decisions.outcome: Excellent - NeighborhoodShare 2,826 lines, Local LLM 1,705 lines, 23 new RAG entries

key_decisions.decision: Launch with 2 AI-focused case studies, defer AI Memory and Home Media Server
key_decisions.rationale: Speed to launch, laser-focused AI positioning aligns with professional title, 2 comprehensive case studies better than 3 decent ones, can add more post-launch
key_decisions.impact: Faster launch (~1 week savings), clearer positioning, flexibility to iterate
key_decisions.outcome: In progress - focus on NeighborhoodShare + Local LLM case studies

key_decisions.decision: Create MikeJones.online website case study as top post-launch priority
key_decisions.rationale: Meta/self-referential (compelling narrative), demonstrates practical AI implementation in business context, showcases RAG architecture and multi-agent coordination, aligns with 2026 employer trends (AI applied to business problems)
key_decisions.impact: Strong post-launch case study demonstrating complete AI implementation process
key_decisions.outcome: Planned for Phase 7.3 after chatbot implementation

key_decisions.decision: Expand Debbie's role to Design System Architect - create complete design system before any page work
key_decisions.rationale: Need cohesive visual language across entire site. Define color palette, typography, spacing, visual hierarchy, components FIRST, then apply consistently to all pages. Ensures site 'pops' and reflects Mike's AI expertise positioning. Browser automation challenges highlighted need for better process: design system definition → mobiledoc assembly → API-based publishing.
key_decisions.impact: Higher quality, more consistent design. Debbie has authority to override Kyoto defaults or recommend theme changes. Design system becomes reusable foundation for all future pages and will inform mobiledoc assembler workflow.
alternatives_considered: Continue page-by-page approach without unified design system
key_decisions.outcome: ✅ Complete - Debbie created comprehensive 1,687-line design system document with brand essence, color palette (Indigo + Neon Cyan accents), typography (Inter + JetBrains Mono), spacing system, component library, page guidelines. Ready for implementation.

key_decisions.decision: Keep UX/IA responsibilities with Debbie instead of creating separate UXIA agent
key_decisions.rationale: ChatGPT suggested separate UXIA (UX/Information Architecture) agent for page structure. Analysis showed: (1) Senior designers already do IA + visual design together (industry standard), (2) Debbie's agent file already includes IA as core responsibility, (3) Design system already constrains choices, (4) Extra agent adds coordination overhead without benefit, (5) PAGE_SPEC (Debbie's output) is what Doc Brown needs anyway. Separating IA from visual design is artificial for this project size (7 pages, 1 designer).
key_decisions.impact: Simpler workflow (3 agents vs 4), faster execution, clearer ownership. Debbie outputs PAGE_SPEC that includes both IA (section order, visual pacing, density) and design specs (typography, spacing, colors from design system). Clean handoff to Doc Brown for Mobiledoc conversion.
alternatives_considered: Create separate UXIA agent (4-agent workflow: UXIA → Debbie → Doc Brown → Alice)
Split IA and visual design into separate steps
key_decisions.outcome: ✅ Complete - Enhanced Debbie's agent definition with explicit PAGE_SPEC output format, formalized IA responsibilities (visual pacing, whitespace, CTA timing), documented Kyoto constraints. Workflow remains: Debbie → Doc Brown → Alice.

challenges_encountered.description: Ghost editor uses complex iframe structure that's difficult to automate reliably. Direct DOM manipulation doesn't always work.
challenges_encountered.workaround: Using Ghost API where possible, manual verification when automation fails
challenges_encountered.impact: Slows down page updates, requires alternative approaches

variables.GHOST_ADMIN_API_KEY: For creating/updating content (Admin API - format: id:secret)

security.documentation: See CLAUDE.md section 'Environment Variables & Ghost API Configuration'

usage.python: Use python-dotenv to load: load_dotenv() then os.getenv('GHOST_ADMIN_API_KEY')
usage.agents: Agents can read .env when needing programmatic Ghost API access

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Ensuring content consistency across multiple pages and agents
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Created RAG knowledge base (123 entries) as single source of truth, all agents verify facts against RAG
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Consistent professional title, experience years, project details across all content

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Creating comprehensive case studies without complete project documentation
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Ted conducts structured technical interviews before case study creation, produces 1,500-3,000 line technical docs
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: NeighborhoodShare (2,826 lines) and Local LLM (1,705 lines) comprehensive documentation
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - enables deep, accurate case studies showcasing technical sophistication

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Coordinating multiple agents working in parallel
challenges_and_solutions.solution: NATS JetStream coordination system with task queue and coordination channel
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Two web content builders worked simultaneously on different tasks without conflicts
challenges_and_solutions.impact: Medium - enabled parallel work, prevented duplicate effort

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Determining optimal case study portfolio for launch
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Strategic decision: 2 comprehensive AI-focused case studies align with positioning, defer others post-launch
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Faster path to launch (~1 week savings), clearer AI positioning
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - prioritizes speed and positioning clarity

challenges_and_solutions.solution: Project Manager creates and maintains comprehensive PROJECT-MEMORY.json documenting decisions, workflows, challenges
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Complete project history for case study creation and future reference
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - enables MikeJones.online case study, institutional knowledge preservation

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Agent continuity across sessions - agents losing context when work pauses
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Implemented Agent Memory System - each agent gets their own JSON memory file (AGENT-MEMORY-TEMPLATE.json as standard). Agents read memory at startup, update during work, log decisions and learnings.
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Debbie (Web Design Agent) launched with DEBBIE-MEMORY.json. Agents can now pick up where they left off, track their own work, document decisions with reasoning, build expertise over time.
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - Enables long-running agent work across multiple sessions, transparency for PM, knowledge preservation, quality tracking

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Site quality issues - published pages had errors (wrong job titles, missing images, placeholder text, poor design)
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Created Debbie (Web Design Agent) with 20+ years expertise in web design, Ghost/Kyoto mastery, portfolio website specialization. Agent has deep knowledge of modern design trends and Mike's product goals. Works autonomously with expert decisions.
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Debbie fixing all 7 existing pages. 3 of 7 complete (Contact, Homepage, Projects Landing). Remaining: Resume, About, and add images to 2 case studies.
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - Professional quality design, factual accuracy, strategic image placement, modern aesthetics

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Browser automation limitations with Ghost editor
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Debbie working around Ghost editor's complex iframe structure. Using Ghost API where possible, manual verification when automation fails.
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: Slower page updates but maintaining quality. Finding alternative approaches for reliable updates.
challenges_and_solutions.impact: Medium - Impacts velocity but doesn't block progress. Documented in Debbie's memory for future learning.

challenges_and_solutions.challenge: Browser automation unreliable for page creation - led to complete workflow redesign
challenges_and_solutions.solution: Complete process pivot: (1) Expanded Debbie's role to Design System Architect - create comprehensive design system FIRST, (2) New Mobiledoc Assembler agent converts design specs to valid Mobiledoc JSON, (3) Alice publishes via Ghost Admin API (no browser automation), (4) Pilot test on About page before rollout. See /plans/workflow-questions.md for details.
challenges_and_solutions.outcome: New workflow: Design System → Page Design → Mobiledoc Assembly → API Publishing. More reliable, repeatable, version-controllable. Design system ensures consistency across all pages.
challenges_and_solutions.impact: High - Solves automation challenges, improves quality through design system, creates sustainable process for all future pages. Workflow questions documented for pilot test validation.
challenges_and_solutions.status: In progress - Design System creation (Phase 3.0) assigned to Debbie

lessons_learned: Ghost Pro dramatically accelerates launch vs. self-hosted (eliminated 1 week of infrastructure work)
Structured technical interviews produce exceptional case study source material (2,000+ lines per project)
RAG knowledge base ensures content consistency across multiple agents and pages
NATS coordination enables parallel agent work without conflicts
Quality over quantity: 2 comprehensive case studies > 3 decent ones
Speed to launch matters: defer non-critical features to post-launch iteration
Agent specialization works: Ted for technical depth, Alice for content creation, Debbie for design, Morgan for coordination
Project memory documentation enables meta case study (MikeJones.online about building MikeJones.online)
Agent memory files critical for continuity - agents need to remember work across sessions, track decisions, build expertise
Published content needs quality review - initial pages had factual errors (job titles), missing images, placeholder text
Expert design agents need deep platform knowledge (Ghost/Kyoto) and product understanding (portfolio websites) to make autonomous decisions
Browser automation has limitations - Ghost editor's iframe structure difficult to automate, need workarounds and API usage
Human-AI collaboration works best when agents are treated as teammates with continuity, respect, and trust - not transactional tools
Agent personalities and names matter - Ted, Alice, Debbie, Morgan have distinct roles and relationships that strengthen collaboration
Iterative learning together (human + AI) produces better results than directive-only interaction - challenges become opportunities
The collaboration methodology itself is part of the deliverable - how this site was built is as valuable as what was built
Design systems first, implementation second - comprehensive design system ensures consistency and guides all page creation work
API-based publishing more reliable than browser automation - Mobiledoc JSON + Ghost Admin API eliminates iframe automation challenges
Process pivots based on learnings - browser automation struggles led to improved Design → Mobiledoc → API workflow
Pilot testing new workflows reduces risk - validate approach on one page before rolling out to all remaining work
